messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] "The Big Box"
messages.msgSnippet: This is one of our favorite books.. and it leads to lots of discussions. I also highly recommend it. susan On Thursday, December 12, 2002, at 12:22  PM, Lisa
messages.messageBody:
This is one of our favorite books.. and it leads to lots of discussions.
I also highly recommend it.
susan

On Thursday, December 12, 2002, at 12:22 PM, Lisa Anselmo
<lanselmo3@...> wrote:

> Reading some of these posts about personal freedoms, etc.
> reminded me of Toni Morrison's book for children, "The Big Box".
> She wrote it along with her son when he began having problems
> at school. If you haven't read it, it's great. Here's a quote from the
> book: "...But if freedom is handled just your way, then it's not my
> freedom, or free."
>
> Lisa
>
>

Susan

"Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can
change the world; indeed, it is the only thing that ever has."
- Margaret Mead

"All we are saying is give peace a chance."

messages.subject: "The Big Box"
messages.msgSnippet: Reading some of these posts about personal freedoms, etc. reminded me of Toni Morrison s book for children, The Big Box . She wrote it along with her son when
messages.messageBody:
Reading some of these posts about personal freedoms, etc.
reminded me of Toni Morrison's book for children, "The Big Box".
She wrote it along with her son when he began having problems
at school. If you haven't read it, it's great. Here's a quote from the
book: "...But if freedom is handled just your way, then it's not my
freedom, or free."

Lisa
